ticketFields.title: Description
ticketFields.description: Please enter the details of your request. A member of our support staff will respond as soon as possible.

ticketFields.title: Serial Number
ticketFields.description: You can find a device's serial number by following the instructions here: https://support.particle.io/hc/en-us/articles/360045422954, or by checking the Console if the device has come online. Serial numbers are different from Device ID and look like this: "E42TAB852123456" or "B40KAB851123456".

ticketFields.title: I Have Tried Disabling Other Extensions in VSCode
ticketFields.description: It's often worth disabling all other active extensions in case they are interfering with Workbench: https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/editor/extension-gallery#_disable-an-extension.

ticketFields.title: Check Cellular guides
ticketFields.description:
Please check our guide on Cellular Connectivity Troubleshooting (https://support.particle.io/hc/en-us/articles/360044518213-Cellular-Connectivity-Troubleshooting-Guide).
If you are encountering issues of Poor Connectivity and OTA failures, please read our guide (https://support.particle.io/hc/en-us/articles/4412821956507-Troubleshooting-Poor-Connectivity-Issues-OTA).

ticketFields.title: Event Date (or Start Date)
ticketFields.description: Please give us the date of your event, or the date that your event begins.

ticketFields.title: Are You Able to Source Logs from Electron Cloud Debug?
ticketFields.description: This is a useful logging tool that provides device-side logs documenting connectivity issues. You can find instructions here: https://github.com/particle-iot/cloud-debug, and some guidelines here: https://support.particle.io/hc/en-us/articles/360044518213. Providing at least 10 minutes of logs with your ticket will substantially reduce ticket resolution time.

ticketFields.title: CLI Issue Referral
ticketFields.description: Have you referred to our CLI Troubleshooting Guide (https://support.particle.io/hc/en-us/articles/1260801311330-Troubleshooting-the-Particle-CLI)) and followed the instructions for issue submission?

ticketFields.title: Device ID(s)
ticketFields.description: Please list any and all relevant Device IDs. Please see the "How Do I find My Device ID" article in our Support Portal if you need help finding your IDs (https://support.particle.io/hc/en-us/articles/360045422954). If no devices are involved and this is a more general question, select another category or enter "N/A."

Does Your Network Involve a Captive Portal?
ticketFields.description: (e.g. a page that appears and prompts you for further authentication once connecting to your network)

ticketFields.title: ICCID(s)
ticketFields.description: An ICCID is a 19-20 digit number beginning with 8. The ICCID identifies your SIM card(s). You can find this information by following the same steps as here: https://support.particle.io/hc/en-us/articles/360045422954 (which will print both Device ID and ICCID). Your ICCID should also be visible in the Console under https://console.particle.io/sims (or in the SIM page of one of your Products).

ticketFields.title: My Question is Not Resolved by Reviewing Particle's Datasheets

ticketFields.description: Please add the Product IDs of the Products you wish to transfer out of your Sandbox into your Growth Plan. You can find more information about Products here: https://docs.particle.io/tutorials/product-tools/introduction/#products.

ticketFields.title: Expected Firmware Behavior (e.g. Sleep Cycle)
ticketFields.description: Please provide a brief description of the expected behavior of the device - for example: "my devices come online once per hour, make a telemetry reading, and sleep after 10 minutes."

ticketFields.title: Are You Able to Source Logs from Boron Cloud Debug?
ticketFields.description: This is a useful logging tool that provides device-side logs documenting connectivity issues. You can find instructions here: https://github.com/particle-iot/cloud-debug, and some guidelines here: https://support.particle.io/hc/en-us/articles/360044518213. Providing at least 10 minutes of logs with your ticket will substantially reduce ticket resolution time.

ticketFields.title: GPS Coordinates or Street Address
ticketFields.description: Providing our team with device GPS Coordinates and/or a street address can significantly improve resolution time for cellular connectivity support requests.

ticketFields.title: Are You Able to Source Debug Logs From Your Tracker?
ticketFields.description: You can follow the instructions here to source debug logs from your Tracker: https://github.com/particle-iot/cloud-debug. Alternatively, you can follow the instructions here (as debug logs may already be configured for this device):  https://support.particle.io/hc/en-us/articles/360058524014. Providing at least 10 minutes of logs with your ticket will substantially reduce ticket resolution time. PLEASE NOTE: if your ticket does not submit, it may be because you've gone over the character limit. Trim your logs down to relevant errors and try again.

ticketFields.title: Have you consulted with our active Particle Community?

 (https://community.particle.io) first before creating this ticket, as you're likely to be speaking with peers who have already been working with a similar implementation. Please provide a link to your Community post above.
